required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Quantitative Evaluation of Skin Shrinkage Caused by a Non-invasive Tightening Device
clinical_study.official_title: Quantitative Evaluation of Skin Shrinkage Caused by a Non-invasive Tightening Device

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to measure the amount of skin shrinkage caused by a non-invasive skin tightening device.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: The Change in Skin Tightening in the Upper Inner or Outer Arm (as Measured by Millimeters)
primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately following treatment and 30 days after last treatment
primary_outcome.description: The documented variable was shrinkage length in millimeters as measured by the same straight ruler used throughout the experimentation. Measurements were taken immediately following treatment and thirty days following the last treatment

arm_group.description: Treatment using a non-invasive skin tightening radiofrequency device to observe skin shrinkage in the arms

intervention.description: One treatment pass on one arm. 2-5 treatment passes on the other

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 30-60 y/o
- Mild to moderate laxity of arm skin
- Skin of Fitzpatrick levels I-III
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any active local arm infections
- Scarring or abnormalities in upper arm area
- Major systemic illnesses
- Any condition with delayed wound healing
- History of psychiatrist illnesses

facility.name: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine, Department of Dermatology

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor in Dermatology, Otolaryngology - Head and Neck Surgery, and Surgery-Organ Transplantation

clinical_study.keyword: None- Normal healthy upper arm skin will be used.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The principal investigator will select patients presenting to the Dermatology Clinic at Northwestern Memorial Hospital who meet the inclusion criteria. These individuals will be referred to the trained researcher running the study. A brief, written description of the study will be given to the patient.

group.title: Thermage
group.description: Thermage ThermaCool®NXT system is a non-invasive skin tightening device designed to deliver energy to the deep dermal layer.Here it will be used to observe skin shrinkage in the arms

group.title: Thermage

outcome.description: The documented variable was shrinkage length in millimeters as measured by the same straight ruler used throughout the experimentation. Measurements were taken immediately following treatment and thirty days following the last treatment
outcome.time_frame: immediately following treatment and 30 days after last treatment

reported_events.desc: Adverse events included pain during the treatment when using the higher energy setting or treatment on the anterior, immediate erythema and swelling. However, none of the subjects experienced adverse events.

group.title: Thermage
group.description: Thermage ThermaCool®NXT system is a non-invasive skin tightening device designed to deliver energy to the deep dermal layer.Here it will be used to observe skin shrinkage in the arms

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
